botanical_details.genus: Pelargonium can be perennials, sub-shrubs or shrubs, sometimes succulent and mostly evergreen, with palmately lobed or pinnately divided leaves and clusters of slightly irregular, 5-petalled flowers
botanical_details.horticultural_group: Scented-leaved pelargoniums are evergreen shrubs or perennials with strongly aromatic foliage and small, single flowers in shades of pink, purple or white

how_to_grow.cultivation: Grow in neutral or alkaline, well-drained, moderately fertile soil in full sun. Lift outdoor plants and keep in frost-free, well- lit conditions over winter. See pelargonium cultivation
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by softwood cuttings in spring, late summer and autumn
how_to_grow.pruning: Deadhead regularly. Cut back if re-potting to over-winter indoors
how_to_grow.pests: Generally trouble-free but may be susceptible to the usual glasshouse pests, especially such as aphids in spring
how_to_grow.diseases: Generally trouble free, but may be susceptible to pelargonium rust and Pelargonium viruses
